newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Moody's upgrades deposit ratings on Jyske Bank.
newsitem.headline: Moody's upgrades deposit ratings on Jyske Bank.

text.p: Credit ratings agency Moody's said on Thursday it upgraded the deposit ratings on Denmark's Jyske Bank to A2/Prime-1 from A3/Prime-2 because of sustained improvement in the bank's financial fundamentals.

According to Moody's the upgrades reflect the sustained improvement in the bank's financial fundamentals, which significantly lowers its risk profile, and the bank's focused strategy in an increasingly competitive environment.

Since the banking crisis of the early 1990's Jyske Bank has achieved a wide ranging improvement in its financial fundamentals. Profitability has been restored to a satisfactory level, as have capital ratios.

Asset quality has improved, and the loan portfolio now shows satisfactory sectoral and customer diversification, and a good level of provisioning, while credit policies and procedures have been tightened.
